oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Snow Benefit at the Grand Ole Opry - 1978-08-31 - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of the Hank Snow Benefit Concert at the Grand Ole Opry. The segment is hosted by T. Tommy Cutrer (musician) and features performances by: Ralph Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers (musical group), Conway Twitty (musician) and Loretta Lynn (musician). The recording is from August 31, 1978. The tape is part three of four.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers; Loretta Lynn; Conway Twitty;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) T. Tommy Cutrer discusses microphone issues and explains the process of changing equipment in the Grand Ole Opry -- (02:30) Cutrer mentions his wife and daughter -- (06:20) Cutrer introduces Conway Twitty -- (07:02) Honky Tonk (Conway Twitty) -- (09:18) Play, Guitar Play (Conway Twitty) -- (11:13) I See the Want to in Your Eyes (Conway Twitty) -- (13:04) Fifteen Years Ago (Conway Twitty) -- (14:30) Touch the Hand (Conway Twitty) -- (16:11) Boogie Grass Band (Conway Twitty) -- (18:30) Linda on My Mind (Conway Twitty) -- (20:54) Maybelline (Conway Twitty) -- (23:39) Conway Twitty recalls working on rock music -- (25:19) Why Me Lord? (Conway Twitty) -- (29:17) You've Never Been This Far Before (Conway Twitty) -- (32:34) Hello Darlin' (Conway Twitty) -- (35:09) It's Only Make Believe (Conway Twitty) -- (36:25) Unidentified tune (Ralph Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers) -- (37:34) Cutrer jokes about the dangers of being an mc; additionally, Cutrer talks about Twitty's life of travel and rambles -- (44:44) Hey Loretta (Loretta Lynn) -- (46:52) Will the Rest of the World Goes to Sleep [unconfirmed] (Loretta Lynn) -- (48:13) Spring Fever (Loretta Lynn) -- (50:42) Lynn jokes about forgetting lyrics -- (51:41) Coal Miner's Daughter (Loretta Lynn) -- (55:42) Lynn reflects on her father never hearing her sing -- (57:43) The Don't Make 'Em Like My Daddy (Loretta Lynn) -- (58:56) Lynn reveals a story about eating a pie with salt -- (1:01:16) One's on the Way (Loretta Lynn) -- (1:03:49) Lynn reflects on having children and singing
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Lynn, Loretta; Lynn, Loretta, 1932-; Twitty, Conway;
